body: a lot of missing tags. rape, incest, dilf, and mind break (maybe) are the big ones.

They kill them and make them into "fertilizer" for the "crop", simple as that, the "miko" is really just a trap (in more ways then one) to get the "vistors" to stay longer then they normally would me thinks, giving them time to "arrange things" before "making them disappear". To everyone else not in the know (Like the Trap) they just assumed they left and that was that (to everyone else, they disappeared likely FAR from the village as possible, likely how they were able to keep up this "tradition" to the modern age, it would look MAJORLY suspicious after a while if enough men "disappeared" after staying in the village, causing visitation to TANK HARD).
What does that dude mean by let's make them disappear
so good heaven's door mags are amazing
>Heaven's Door / Is that a motherfucking JoJo's reference?
@Pafster nice Mahoujin Guru Guru profile picture, that show is a fantastic comedy that takes a shit on garbage like Konosuba.

Oh fuck this is some dark ass shit bruh, I was supposed to say "I'd fuck them if I were there" but after seeing the subtext in page 24....nope I ain't doing it, I still wonder what would happen if the authority found out about this tradition, they'd probably burn anything related to the ritual and make it obsolete and arrest all people responsible, though it would have been fine if they actually just sticked to having sexual intercourse rather than murder, seriously some cultures and superficial beliefs can be straight up retarded at times, china selling eggs boiled in urine and now this? Wtf
Wow it finally got translated, that took a while.

Funny thing I have to say is.....How the fuck were they able to still practice their "tradition" in the modern age? (made since in the age before phones became a thing, but in the information age, it's strange no one noticed the "travelers" going missing after making it known they were going to a "specific village" that should have already been under suspicion as "many travelers have disappeared" never to be seen again in that area (hell, how they handle the "remains", I'm surprised an investigator or two haven't come around or found anything)
So these farmers are too cheap to buy fertilizer and use human corpses as an alternative source? That's a bit funny if you ask me, but why use the traps to begin with?
Idk but i feel like the travellers are killed at the end and become one of the food sources or maybe they became the "god offering"
